desc: Scizor is a Bug/Steel type Pokmon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Pincer Pokmon. Scizor is a red, metal, ant-like Pokemon with yellow and black patterns on its pincers which resemble an eye pattern. Its body consists of three main parts: the torso, the abdomen and the head. It stands on two legs and has a pair of small wings located on its back which are used to control its body temperature, rather than flying. Scizor's habitat is lush and vast where it can reside with the rest of the swarm. Scizor evolves from the Bug/Flying type Scyther, thus losing its Flying type upon evolution - a rare occurrence for Pokmon. Scizor has a Mega Evolution, available from X & Y onwards.

desc: Chespin is a Grass type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Spiny Nut Pokmon. Chespin has a tough shell covering its head and back. Despite having a curious nature that tends to get it in trouble, Chespin keeps an optimistic outlook and doesn't worry about small details. Chespin evolves into Quilladin at level 16.
name: Chespin

desc: Quilladin is a Grass type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Spiny Armor Pokmon. Upon evolution, the hard spikes on Quilladin's body grow even sturdier. Despite its prickly appearance, Quilladin is considered a gentle Pokmon that avoids battle. Quilladin evolves from Chespin at level 16, and evolves into Chesnaught at level 36.
name: Quilladin

desc: Chesnaught is a Grass/Fighting type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Spiny Armor Pokmon. Chesnaught evolves from Quilladin at level 36.
name: Chesnaught

desc: Fennekin is a Fire type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Fox Pokmon. Fennekin can be temperamental, but it tries to do its best for its Trainer. Searing heat blows from its ears. This Pokmon loves to snack on twigs. Fennekin evolves into Braixen at level 16.
name: Fennekin

desc: Braixen is a Fire type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Fox Pokmon. Braixen no longer eats branches but it still keeps a tree branch in its tail, which seems to calm the Pokmon. It will occasionally wield the branch in battle and use friction to light it on fire. Braixen evolves from Fennekin at level 16, and evolves into Delphox at level 36.
name: Braixen

desc: Delphox is a Fire/Psychic type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Fox Pokmon. Delphox evolves from Braixen at level 36.
name: Delphox

desc: Froakie is a Water type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Bubble Frog Pokmon. Froakie is both light and strong, making it capable of jumping incredibly high. The bubbles on its chest and back protect it from attacks. Froakie may appear absentminded, but in truth it pays close attention to its surroundings at all times. Froakie evolves into Frogadier at level 16.
name: Froakie

desc: Frogadier is a Water type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Bubble Frog Pokmon. During battle, Frogadier confounds its opponents by leaping about the ceiling or into trees. Its jumping skill improves greatly. Frogadier evolves from Froakie at level 16, and evolves into Greninja at level 36.
name: Frogadier

desc: Greninja is a Water/Dark type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Ninja Pokmon. Greninja evolves from Frogadier at level 36. Greninja has a new form Ash-Greninja introduced in Pokmon Sun/Moon.
name: Greninja

desc: Bunnelby is a Normal type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Digging Pokmon. Bunnelby is based on a rabbit. It creates its den by digging in the ground with its large, shovel-shaped ears. They are strong enough to chop right through thick tree roots. Bunnelby evolves into Diggersby at level 20.
name: Bunnelby

desc: Diggersby is a Normal/Ground type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Digging Pokmon. Diggersby evolves from Bunnelby at level 20.
name: Diggersby

desc: Fletchling is a Normal/Flying type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Tiny Robin Pokmon. It has a friendly nature and a beautiful chirp, but Fletchling is also known to be ferocious in battle, capable of unleashing relentless attacks. It evolves into Fletchinder at level 17.
name: Fletchling

desc: Fletchinder is a Fire/Flying type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Ember Pokmon. Fletchinder evolves from Fletchling at level 17 and evolves into Talonflame at level 35.
name: Fletchinder

desc: Talonflame is a Fire/Flying type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Scorching Pokmon. It dives at foes, and then attacks with devastating kicks. It evolves from Fletchinder at level 35.
name: Talonflame

desc: Scatterbug is a Bug type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Scatterdust Pokmon. Scatterbug resides mostly in forests and wild plains. It uses the fur around its neck to control its body temperature.
name: Scatterbug

desc: Spewpa is a Bug type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Scatterdust Pokmon.
name: Spewpa

desc: Vivillon is a Bug/Flying type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Scale Pokmon. Vivillon has 18 different forms, depending on the region set on the 3DS. (Once encountered, changing the region does not change the form found.) There are also two event-exclusive patterns. The forms are:  Meadow Pattern Garden Pattern Archipelago Pattern Continental Pattern Elegant Pattern High Plains Pattern Icy Snow Pattern Jungle Pattern Marine Pattern Modern Pattern Monsoon Pattern Ocean Pattern Polar Pattern River Pattern Sandstorm Pattern Savanna Pattern Sun Pattern Tundra Pattern Pok Ball Pattern (event) Fancy Pattern (event)
name: Vivillon

desc: Litleo is a Fire/Normal type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Lion Cub Pokmon. Its mane blazes with heat during battle, burning hotter and hotter the stronger its opponent.
name: Litleo

desc: Pyroar is a Fire/Normal type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Royal Pokmon. When Litleo evolves into Pyroar, it gains a great mane of burning flame! Male and female Pyroar have different forms - the male has a large mane (see below), while the female is more sleek.
name: Pyroar

desc: Flabb is a Fairy type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Single Bloom Pokmon. Flabb has several forms, based on the flower it is holding. They are each found in wild flower patches corresponding to its color. The forms are: Yellow Flower, Red Flower, Orange Flower, Blue Flower and White Flower.
name: Flabebe

desc: Floette is a Fairy type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Single Bloom Pokmon. Like Flabb, Floette has several forms: Yellow Flower, Red Flower, Orange Flower, Blue Flower and White Flower.
name: Floette

desc: Florges is a Fairy type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Garden Pokmon. Like Flabb, Florges has several forms: Yellow Flower, Red Flower, Orange Flower, Blue Flower and White Flower.
name: Florges

desc: Skiddo is a Grass type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Mount Pokmon. Skiddo is said to have been the first Pokmon to live alongside humans. It has become able to read the feelings of its riders through their grip on its horns.
name: Skiddo

desc: Gogoat is a Grass type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Mount Pokmon. Gogoat is so large that people are able to ride on its back. It's very calm, and can form a strong bond with its Trainer's feelings when its Trainer grabs onto its horns.
name: Gogoat

desc: Pancham is a Fighting type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Playful Pokmon. With its trademark leaf always sticking out of its mouth, Pancham tries to intimidate its opponents by glaring at them intensely (although this is rarely successful).
name: Pancham

desc: Pangoro is a Fighting/Dark type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Daunting Pokmon. Pangoro is a cantankerous Pokmon, but it has a strong heart and doesn't forgive those who pick on the weak.
name: Pangoro

desc: Furfrou is a Normal type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Poodle Pokmon. Furfrou can have its appearance changed by grooming. There are number of different appearances it can take, and the more it's groomed, the more styles become available. Furfrou is also considered very intelligent and loyal to its Trainer. It's said that in ancient times, Furfrou guarded the king of Kalos.
name: Furfrou

desc: Espurr is a Psychic type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Restraint Pokmon. The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.
name: Espurr

desc: Meowstic is a Psychic type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Constraint Pokmon. Meowstic is based on a cat. The organs within Meowstic's ears possess a formidable psychic power, so it usually keeps them clamped shut. But when Meowstic is threatened, it will lift its ears and release this power. Meowstic has different forms depending on its gender. The male is mainly blue and learns more defensive moves; the female is mainly white and learns more attacking moves.
name: Meowstic

desc: Honedge is a Steel/Ghost type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Sword Pokmon.
name: Honedge

desc: Doublade is a Steel/Ghost type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Sword Pokmon. Doublade is capable of carrying out intricate attacks by telepathically coordinating its two blades to deliver twice the slice in battle.
name: Doublade

desc: Aegislash is a Steel/Ghost type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Royal Sword Pokmon. Aegislash has two different forms - Shield Forme, which is more defensive, and Blade Forme, which is more offensive. Its ability, Stance Change, causes Aegislash to change into Shield Forme when a defensive move is used, or change into Blade Forme when an attacking move is used.
name: Aegislash

desc: Spritzee is a Fairy type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Perfume Pokmon. It emits a unique fragrance from its body, and any who smell it fall under its spell. Spritzee is exclusive to Pokemon Y.
name: Spritzee

desc: Aromatisse is a Fairy type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Fragrance Pokmon. Aromatisse can give off a variety of different smells, from a pleasant fragrance to an odor so repugnant to its opponent that it can turn a battle in its favor.
name: Aromatisse

desc: Swirlix is a Fairy type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Cotton Candy Pokmon. It loves sweets and eats nothing else, making its body as sweet and sticky as cotton candy. Swirlix is exclusive to Pokemon X.
name: Swirlix

desc: Slurpuff is a Fairy type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Meringue Pokmon. Slurpuff has an unbelievable sense of smell - a hundred million times more sensitive than that of humans. With its highly attuned senses, it can distinguish the faintest of odors.
name: Slurpuff

desc: Inkay is a Dark/Psychic type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Revolving Pokmon. Transmitters above Inkay's eyes have the ability to drain the will to fight from other Pokmon. It uses this skill to run and hide when attacked by stronger enemies.
name: Inkay

desc: Malamar is a Dark/Psychic type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Overturning Pokmon. Malamar wields some of the strongest hypnotic powers of any Pokmon and can make its opponents bend to its will.
name: Malamar

desc: Binacle is a Rock/Water type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Two-Handed Pokmon.
name: Binacle

desc: Barbaracle is a Rock/Water type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Collective Pokmon.
name: Barbaracle

desc: Skrelp is a Poison/Water type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Mock Kelp Pokmon. Disguised by its shape, Skrelp pretends to be a piece of seaweed. When prey gets too close, Skrelp bathes it in poison to keep it from struggling. Skrelp is exclusive to Pokemon Y.
name: Skrelp

desc: Dragalge is a Poison/Dragon type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Mock Kelp Pokmon. Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return. When Dragalge evolves from Skrelp, its loses its Water type and gains Dragon type.
name: Dragalge

desc: Clauncher is a Water type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Water Gun Pokmon. It has an oversized claw on one of its arms. This useful claw can seize prey and shoot water at others as a projectile. Clauncher is exclusive to Pokemon X.
name: Clauncher

desc: Clawitzer is a Water type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Howitzer Pokmon.
name: Clawitzer

desc: Helioptile is an Electric/Normal type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Generator Pokmon. It charges itself by bathing in the light of the sun, providing it with enough energy that it doesn't need to eat.
name: Helioptile

desc: Heliolisk is an Electric/Normal type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Generator Pokmon.
name: Heliolisk

desc: Tyrunt is a Rock/Dragon type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Royal Heir Pokmon. It's believed that Tyrunt is over one hundred million years old. The Pokmon is known to be a bit selfish, and will throw a fit when it doesn't like something. Tyrunt is obtained by reviving it from the Jaw Fossil.
name: Tyrunt

desc: Tyrantrum is a Rock/Dragon type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Despot Pokmon. Tyrantrum's jaws can shred thick metal plates as if they were paper.
name: Tyrantrum

desc: Amaura is a Rock/Ice type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Tundra Pokmon. It's believed that Amaura is over one hundred million years old. Amaura is obtained by reviving it from the Sail Fossil.
name: Amaura

desc: Aurorus is a Rock/Ice type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Tundra Pokmon. Aurorus can blast freezing cold air to form a wall of ice to protect itself from attacks.
name: Aurorus

desc: Sylveon is a Fairy type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Intertwining Pokmon.
name: Sylveon

desc: Hawlucha is a Fighting/Flying type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Wrestling Pokmon.
name: Hawlucha

desc: Dedenne is an Electric/Fairy type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Antenna Pokmon. By emitting radio waves from its antenna-shaped whiskers, it can communicate with far-off allies. Dedenne can also plug its tail into outlets to drain electricity from them.
name: Dedenne

desc: Carbink is a Rock/Fairy type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Jewel Pokmon.
name: Carbink

desc: Goomy is a Dragon type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Soft Tissue Pokmon. Goomy is covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.
name: Goomy

desc: Sliggoo is a Dragon type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Soft Tissue Pokmon. Its four horns are a high-performance radar system. It uses them to sense sounds and smells.
name: Sliggoo

desc: Goodra is a Dragon type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Dragon Pokmon.
name: Goodra

desc: Klefki is a Steel/Fairy type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Key Ring Pokmon. Klefki never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.
name: Klefki

desc: Phantump is a Ghost/Grass type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Stump Pokmon. According to old tales, Phantump are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.
name: Phantump

desc: Trevenant is a Ghost/Grass type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Elder Tree Pokmon.
name: Trevenant

desc: Pumpkaboo is a Ghost/Grass type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Pumpkin Pokmon. Pumpkaboo are said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.
name: Pumpkaboo

desc: Gourgeist is a Ghost/Grass type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Pumpkin Pokmon.
name: Gourgeist

desc: Bergmite is an Ice type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Ice Chunk Pokmon. Using air of -150 degrees Farenheit, they freeze opponents solid.
name: Bergmite

desc: Avalugg is an Ice type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Iceberg Pokmon.
name: Avalugg

desc: Noibat is a Flying/Dragon type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Sound Wave Pokmon.
name: Noibat

desc: Noivern is a Flying/Dragon type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Sound Wave Pokmon. It is extremely combative toward anything that wanders too close to it. It flies through even the darkest nights using ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears. Noivern loves fruit, and feeding it fruit will keep it calm.
name: Noivern

desc: Xerneas is a Fairy type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Life Pokmon. Xerneas is a legendary Pokmon exclusive to Pokmon X.
name: Xerneas

desc: Yveltal is a Dark/Flying type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Destruction Pokmon. Yveltal is a legendary Pokmon exclusive to Pokmon Y.
name: Yveltal

desc: Zygarde is a Dragon/Ground type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Order Pokmon. Zygarde is a snake-like legendary Pokmon. Its ability Aura Break counters the effects of the abilities of Xerneas and Yveltal. It was later revealed that Zygarde as seen in Pokmon X & Y is in fact an alternate Forme. Zygarde has five different Formes in total:  Zygarde Cell are single cells that make up Zygarde. They cannot use any moves. Zygarde Core is part of Zygarde's brain, and they are known to take action when the ecosystem changes. Zygarde 10% Forme occurs when Zygarde Core gathers 10% of the Cells nearby. Capable of travelling over 60mph. Zygarde 50% Forme occurs when Zygarde Core gathers 50% of the Cells nearby. This is the standard form. Zygarde Complete Forme is the perfect form, which is more powerful than Xerneas and Yveltal. Zygarde takes this form when the ecosystem is under threat.
name: Zygarde

desc: Diancie is a Rock/Fairy type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Jewel Pokmon. Diancie is an event-exclusive Pokmon. It also has a Mega Evolution, available from Omega Ruby & Alpha Sapphire onwards.
name: Diancie

desc: Hoopa is a Psychic/Ghost type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Mischief Pokmon. Hoopa is an event-exclusive Pokmon.
name: Hoopa

desc: Volcanion is a Fire/Water type Pokmon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Steam Pokmon. Volcanion is an event-exclusive Pokmon; full details are not yet known.
name: Volcanion
